item.title: Share bikes in DC
item.description: The Covid-19 outbreak in 2020 led to business shutting down, and people being socially isolated in their homes. This affected Bike Sharing services, as people were not leaving their homes as often. Capital Bikeshare, the official bikeshare programs for D.C., is steadily recovering from the fall in usage in 2020, following the Covid-19 outbreak. Micro-mobility In 2022 the usage more than doubled from 2020, according to the data released by Capital Bikeshare.

item.title: Contaminated drinking water
item.description: Many often assume that unsafe drinking water is an issue of the past, only felt today by countries in the global south. It’s easy to assume that safe drinking water is accessible in the United States, one of the wealthiest countries in the world. Except, it’s not that simple for a quarter of Americans who do not have access to clean drinking water. For almost 90 million U.S. residents, this is an everyday problem.
